title: Awesome place to solve hard problems
text: Pros Lots of challenges to be solved daily. We’re constantly innovating and it’s exciting to be a part of. What we’re doing is hard and it’s the right environment for doing hard things: tons of transparency, little red tape and lots of collaboration. Cons Despite the size we’ve grown to and the money we’ve raised, things are still early and there’s a lot to be figured out. It’s exciting but can be exhausted. Be ready for the marathon, not the quick win. Advice to Management We need more office space.

title: Great work environment, inspiring vision, incredibly smart employees
text: Pros I don't come from a start-up world, and I have to say I was a little scared when I accepted my position at Common. I couldn't have been more wrong in my fears. Common provides an exceptional work environment, driven by incredibly passionate and intelligent employees. Everybody works hard and is respectful of each other's talents, time, and sensibilities. Unlike the stereotypes of a typical start-up, there's a real respect for work-life balance, and the company is driven by true work ethic and a belief that we're providing for the future of housing in cities, with no ego coming into play. It's refreshing to look forward to coming into work every morning. Cons None that come to mind yet. Advice to Management Keep doing what you're doing; it's fostering a great environment.
